name: Hell-Bound Train
description: In this parable, sinners of all kinds board a hell-bound train conducted by Satan, while others choose not to board or leave and repent.

name: Hot Biskits / The Blood of Jesus
description: A con man uses magnets to help his pal win a golf game. A godless man who accidentally shot his wife fervently prays while she dreams of redemption.

name: Verdict Not Guilty / Heaven-Bound Travelers
description: At the gates of Heaven, Truth defends an unmarried woman who died in childbirth. People fight despair and Satan's temptations on the way to heaven.

name: The Symbol of the Unconquered: A Story of the KKK
description: A light-skinned black woman falls for a kind black man who thinks she's white. Both become targets of a self-loathing biracial man passing as white.

name: Two Knights of Vaudeville / Mercy the Mummy Mumbled
description: Two men thrown out of a big vaudeville show put on their own show back home. To win his sweetheart, a man 'helps' her scientist dad reanimate a mummy.

name: Birthright
description: A Harvard-educated black man goes back to his Southern hometown to start a school, but racism and love for a local girl throw obstacles in his path.

name: Veiled Aristocrats
description: When a young black man who passed for white in college returns to his hometown, he finds his light-skinned sister has fallen for a darker-skinned man.

name: Within Our Gates
description: A woman victimized by a cousin who secretly loved her fianc√© tries to save a school for black children, but her past and society work against her.

name: The Girl from Chicago
description: After a federal agent falls for a Mississippi teacher and saves her from a crime kingpin, the pair escapes to Harlem, where safety still eludes them.

name: Ten Nights in a Bar Room
description: After a saloon owner loses everything to an incorrigible vice lord, he becomes a drunkard -- until fate intervenes.

name: The Darktown Revue
description: Donald Heywood's Choir performs several songs. Tim Moore and other comedians appear in sketches between songs.

name: The Flying Ace
description: A former World War I flying ace becomes a railroad detective to go after a romantic rival and fellow aviator who pulls off a large payroll robbery.

name: Eleven P.M.
description: A writer who believes man's psyche can take refuge in lower animal forms falls asleep while working on a story and has a bizarre dream.

name: Dirty Gertie from Harlem USA
description: A famous and very flirtatious Harlem stripper visits a tropical island, where her past and her conscience catch up with her.

name: A Reckless Rover
description: A policeman tries to arrest a sleeping man in a boardinghouse, but he escapes, runs through the neighborhood, then hides in a Chinese laundry.

name: Body and Soul
description: An escaped criminal hides in a small town, posing as a pastor to steal from his congregation, work as a bootlegger and conceal his own depravity.

name: The Scar of Shame
description: A young composer marries a poor girl to save her from her stepfather's advances, but society's failure to help women like her continues to haunt them.

name: The Bronze Buckaroo
description: When cowboy Bob Blake learns that his friend Joe needs help, he rides to Joe's ranch but discovers he's been missing for weeks.

name: The Exile
description: A black man leaves Chicago and becomes a successful farmer, but after falling for a white woman, he returns and gets entangled with an old flame.

name: Ten Minutes to Live
description: At a Harlem nightclub, a woman receives a note saying she has only 10 minutes to live. The reason is connected to a murder from years before.

name: The New Housekeeper
description: Opie's housekeeper is off to get married. Andy's Aunt Bee -- who raised him -- is coming to replace her, but Opie refuses to give her a chance.

name: The Manhunt
description: Andy and Barney are left out of the state police's manhunt, so the two spring into action -- and are caught off guard by the criminal.

name: The Guitar Player
description: Andy has trouble persuading Jim Lindsey to go to New York -- where he can make his talent pay off -- until a tour band stops in Mayberry for lunch.

name: Ellie Comes to Town
description: New pharmacist Ellie Walker incurs the wrath of Emma by refusing to sell Emma her pills. Emma takes to her sickbed and milks it for all it's worth.

name: Irresistible Andy
description: Andy wrongly assumes that Ellie is out to trap him into marriage, so he tries setting her up with other men to avoid an unwanted wedding.

name: Runaway Kid
description: After Andy talks to Opie about keeping promises, Opie's confused when Andy asks him to break his word and reveal his runaway friend's identity.

name: Andy the Matchmaker
description: Barney's self-esteem is at its lowest and he's ready to quit the police force. To build his confidence, Andy and Ellie stage a fake robbery.

name: Opie's Charity
description: Andy thinks Opie is squandering his money because he wants to buy his girlfriend a gift. Aunt Bee scolds Andy for not having more faith in his son.

name: A Feud is a Feud
description: A young couple wants to tie the knot. The pair's feuding fathers stop the wedding at gunpoint. Andy decides to end the feud before marrying them.

name: Ellie for Council
description: The town divides when Ellie runs for city council, with the men cutting off their wives' charge accounts and the women refusing to cook and clean.

name: Christmas Story
description: Ben doesn't want Sam's moonshine to outsell his legal liquor. Andy arrests Sam -- but also arrests his family so they can be together for the holiday.

name: Stranger in Town
description: A stranger named Ed Sawyer comes to town. The suspicious citizens want Andy to do something about him, but because he's broken no laws, Andy refuses.

name: Mayberry Goes Hollywood
description: A Hollywood producer wants to film in Mayberry. Despite Andy's objections, Barney, the council, Aunt Bee and Opie are caught up in the hysteria.

name: The Horse Trader
description: Andy reminds Opie that honesty is the best policy. But when Andy and Barney must sell an old cannon, Andy makes up a history for the old gun.

name: Those Gossipin' Men
description: Irritated that Andy is teasing her friends about being gossips, Aunt Bee hints that there may be more to a traveling shoe salesman than meets the eye.

name: The Beauty Contest
description: Andy is picked to be a beauty contest judge. The townsfolk drive him crazy by parading their loved ones in front of him to try to influence his vote.

name: Alcohol and Old Lace
description: The Morrison sisters tell Andy and Barney the locations of some stills. But they discover that the Morrisons were just getting rid of the competition.

name: Andy, the Marriage Counselor
description: After being warned about fighting, the Boones are at it again when Barney hauls them in. Andy tries to make the Boones be civil to each other.

name: Mayberry on Record
description: A promoter is rounding up talent in Mayberry to make an album of folk music. When the townsfolk invest in it, Andy thinks they've fallen for a con.

name: Andy Saves Barney's Morale
description: With Andy away in Centerville, Barney is acting sheriff. When Andy returns eight hours later, he finds half the townsfolk in jail on flimsy charges.

name: Andy and the Gentleman Crook
description: 'Gentleman Dan' Caldwell is in the Mayberry jail, and in no time he has Barney, Opie and Aunt Bee eating out of his hand with his polite manners.

name: Cyrano Andy
description: Barney can't seem to express his feelings on his dates with Thelma Lou. After Andy tells her how Barney feels, she decides to make him jealous.

name: Andy and Opie, Housekeepers
description: Aunt Bee leaves town but frets that Andy and Opie won't survive without her. The house is a mess, and they rush to clean up before Aunt Bee returns.

name: The New Doctor
description: Andy assumes Ellie will be going to the social with him. When he goes to invite Ellie, he meets a doctor who's new in town -- and attracted to Ellie.

name: A Plaque for Mayberry
description: The Women's Historical Society believes the descendant of a war hero is living in Mayberry. Barney deduces that he's the person they're looking for.

name: The Inspector
description: State inspector Ralph Case doesn't like what he sees and starts noting violations. He condemns Andy's methods and is ready to recommend impeachment.

name: Ellie Saves a Female
description: When a farmer's daughter isn't allowed to buy cosmetics, Ellie decides to give the girl a few of the items, against Andy's warning about meddling.

name: Andy Forecloses
description: Ben Weaver wants Andy to serve a foreclosure notice on the Scobeys. When Ben says he's owed the full balance, Andy finds ways to stall the process.

name: Quiet Sam
description: Barney comes to the conclusion that Sam is tending to someone with a bullet wound. Barney and Andy drive to Sam's place to satisfy Barney's curiosity.

name: Barney Gets His Man
description: Barney writes a litterbug a ticket for a man who flees. He and Barney get tangled up, and Barney is credited with the capture of an escaped convict.

name: The Guitar Player Returns
description: When musician Jim Lindsey returns to town, he starts bragging about the offers he's getting. But Andy soon learns that Jim can't pay his bills.

name: Bringing Up Opie
description: Andy has to tell Opie the courthouse is off limits. But as Opie drifts from place to place looking for something else to do, he finds trouble.

name: Opie and the Bully
description: Sheldon is bullying Opie by forcing him to pay a nickel to pass by his street. As Opie asks for nickels, Andy becomes aware something is wrong.

name: Barney's Replacement
description: A lawyer is in Mayberry to work with Andy as a deputy -- which doesn't sit well with Barney, who thinks Andy is displeased with his performance.

name: Andy and the Woman Speeder
description: Finished fishing, Andy tickets a female speeding driver. When her attitude lands her in jail, she uses her feminine wiles to sway the witnesses.

name: Mayberry Goes Bankrupt
description: Frank Myers lives in a run-down house and is delinquent on taxes. The council evicts him. Andy serves the papers and makes a surprising discovery.

name: Barney on the Rebound
description: When Barney is taken with a new girl, he and Thelma go their separate ways. Barney dates the new girl -- but things start moving too fast for him.

name: Opie's Hobo Friend
description: Opie meets a wanderer and forms a bond with him. But when he picks up the drifter's bad habits, it's up to Andy to get him back on the right track.

name: Crime-Free Mayberry
description: An FBI agent and a photographer recognize Mayberry for having the lowest crime rate. But no one realizes that the two plan to rob the Mayberry Bank.

name: The Perfect Female
description: Barney wants to set Andy up on a date with Thelma Lou's cousin Karen. Andy agrees to meet Karen, and to everyone's delight, the two hit it off.

name: Aunt Bee's Brief Encounter
description: Aunt Bee hires Mr. Wheeler to help with the flowers around the Taylor home. Although Andy has doubts about Wheeler, Aunt Bee is quite taken with him.

name: The Clubmen
description: Roger Courtney invites Andy to come up to the state capital and be considered for membership. Andy accepts but says he's bringing Barney along, too.

name: The Pickle Story
description: Aunt Bee's homemade pickles are terrible, so Andy switches them with store pickles. The plan backfires when Bee enters her pickles in a contest.

name: Sheriff Barney
description: When Barney is offered the job of sheriff in a nearby town, he and Andy trade jobs for a day as a trial run.

name: The Farmer Takes a Wife
description: Farmer 'Big' Jeff Pruitt comes to town looking for a wife. Unfortunately for Barney, Pruitt chooses Thelma Lou.

name: The Keeper of the Flame
description: Opie joins a club and is put in charge of the candle used during the meetings. After the bar burns down, the owner accuses Opie of starting the fire.

name: Bailey's Bad Boy
description: Andy teaches self-reliance and responsibility to a rich man's spoiled son.

name: Manicurist
description: When a pretty, young manicurist starts working in Floyd's Barbershop, the men take to the idea in a big way. Their jealous wives, however, do not.

name: The Jinx
description: The townsfolk believe that Henry Bennett is responsible for many mishaps. Andy invites Henry to join him for opening day of the fishing sweepstakes.

name: Jailbreak
description: The state police come to town to catch some payroll robbers. They want Andy and Barney to stay out of the way but end up needing their help.

name: A Medal for Opie
description: Opie enters the 50-yard dash and thinks he'll be victorious. Barney guarantees him a win. When he comes in last, he's dejected and goes home to pout.

name: Barney and the Choir
description: The choir director invites Barney to join the choir before realizing that Barney can't sing.

name: Guest of Honor
description: The town celebrates Founders' Day by picking a stranger to be the guest of honor. Unfortunately, the person chosen turns out to be a thief.

name: Merchant of Mayberry
description: Andy helps a struggling salesman stay in town.

name: Aunt Bee the Warden
description: With the jail full, Andy must decide what to do with Otis. Out of options, he takes Otis home with him to serve his sentence under watchful Aunt Bee.

name: The County Nurse
description: When farmer Rafe Hollister refuses to take his tetanus shot, Andy and Barney try to persuade him to get vaccinated.

name: Andy and Barney in the Big City
description: When Andy and Barney travel to Raleigh on business, they help catch a jewel thief in their hotel.

name: Wedding Bells for Aunt Bee
description: Clara convinces Aunt Bee she is keeping Andy from finding a wife. When Mr. Goss shows interest in Bee, she fakes attraction and nearly gets married.

name: Three's a Crowd
description: Barney interferes with Andy's new romance.

name: The Bookie Barber
description: Floyd hires a second barber -- who turns out to be a bookie. To catch him and his accomplices, Barney goes undercover as an old lady.

name: Andy on Trial
description: Andy is accused of official misconduct by a big-shot newspaper publisher Andy arrested for a traffic violation.

name: Cousin Virgil
description: Barney's cousin Virgil visits and makes a mess of everything. Andy instills self-confidence in Virgil after discovering something he's good at.

name: Deputy Otis
description: Town drunk Otis is made a temporary deputy to impress his visiting older brother.

name: Mr. McBeevee
description: When Opie starts talking about his new friend Mr. McBeevee, his description is hard to believe.

name: Andy's Rich Girlfriend
description: After Andy finds out his new girlfriend's father is wealthy, Barney convinces Andy that the relationship is doomed.

name: Andy and the New Mayor
description: Mayberry's new mayor doesn't like Andy or the way he does his job.

name: Andy and Opie, Bachelors
description: Aunt Bee leaves town, leaving Andy and Opie to take care of themselves. When Peggy volunteers to cook, Floyd tells Andy that she wants a husband.

name: The Cow Thief
description: The mayor calls in an investigator from the state capital to help solve a string of cow thefts.

name: Barney Mends a Broken Heart
description: After Andy has an argument with Peggy, Barney tries to console him by setting him up with another girl.

name: Lawman Barney
description: Two farmers ignore Barney and make fun of him. Andy tells them a big story about Barney being a coldhearted killer known as Barney the Beast.

name: The Mayberry Band
description: Mayberry's town band is terrible, and the mayor refuses to allow them to go to the state capital to play -- until Andy gets help from Freddy Fleet.

name: Floyd, the Gay Deceiver
description: Floyd has been posing as a rich man in letters to a wealthy widow, and he panics when she visits. But Andy finds out she hasn't been honest, either.

name: Opie's Rival
description: Andy's latest girlfriend is the new county nurse. Everyone likes her except Opie, who's jealous of all the time Andy spends with her.

name: Convicts at Large
description: Three escaped women convicts hold Barney and Floyd hostage in a remote cabin.

name: The Bed Jacket
description: Aunt Bee wants a pretty bed jacket for her birthday. A mix-up causes Andy to have to sell his favorite fishing pole to get it.

name: The Bank Job
description: Barney thinks the Mayberry Bank is a pushover for a robbery and sets out to prove it.

name: One-Punch Opie
description: Opie must learn to fight when a new boy in town ridicules him and begins to lead his friends toward a life of crime.

name: Barney and the Governor
description: After Barney tickets the governor for illegal parking, the governor congratulates him for doing a good job. But Barney thinks he's going to be fired.

name: Man in a Hurry
description: A businessman's car breaks down near town on a Sunday. Andy tries to talk him into staying and getting it fixed Monday, but it's a hard sell -- at first.

name: High Noon in Mayberry
description: Andy receives a letter from an ex-con whom he shot in the leg, saying he's coming to Mayberry to set things straight. Barney assumes the worst.

name: The Loaded Goat
description: A construction crew is blasting for an underpass near Mayberry. The rumor is that the mayor wants to bring the highway past his brother's gas station.

name: Class Reunion
description: At his high school class reunion, Andy finds that some connections are never completely broken, and some hearts never completely heal.

name: Rafe Hollister Sings
description: Andy must find a way to appease all sides as the mayor objects when a golden-voiced farmer is chosen to represent Mayberry in a musical production.

name: Opie and the Spoiled Kid
description: Opie's friend Arnold seems to have it all. When the pressure's on, though, Opie learns that Arnold's assets are also his greatest weaknesses.

name: The Great Filling Station Robbery
description: After a series of auto-related thefts, suspicion looms over Jimmy. How long can Andy rush to Jimmy's defense before his faith in the boy is shaken?

name: Andy Discovers America
description: Opie hates history homework and misinterprets Andy's empathy as an excuse to skip it. When Miss Crump holds Andy responsible, he must motivate Opie.

name: Aunt Bee's Medicine Man
description: Andy must protect Aunt Bee from a traveling snake-oil huckster whose 170-proof 'tonic' provides her temporary relief.

name: The Darlings are Coming
description: Andy has his hands full when a musical mountain family descends upon Mayberry.

name: Andy's English Valet
description: Andy's home becomes his castle as he engages the employment of a bicycle-touring Englishman who must work off an unfortunately earned debt.

name: Barney's First Car
description: It's a red-letter day in Mayberry when Barney decides to join the motoring world, but things go sour when his cream puff turns out to be a lemon.

name: The Rivals
description: When Opie feels too shy to ask Karen to the movies, Thelma Lou boosts Opie's confidence but destroys Barney's. Can Andy realign this love quadrangle?

name: A Wife for Andy
description: Everybody's ready for Andy to get married. But could it be that Andy has his own agenda, unbeknownst to Mayberry's meddlesome matchmakers?

name: Dogs, Dogs, Dogs
description: It's pandemonium when 11 stray dogs invade the courthouse. Andy and Barney have to figure out what to do with them before a state official arrives.

name: Mountain Wedding
description: Ernest decides to court Briscoe's already married daughter. Ernest doesn't see the marriage as legal because it wasn't performed by a preacher.

name: The Big House
description: When the Mayberry jail is needed to house two holdup criminals, it's more than Barney can handle -- especially when he's being 'assisted' by Gomer.

name: Opie the Bird Man
description: After Opie kills a mother bird with his slingshot, he raises her babies. He grows attached to them but is forced to set them free when they get big.

name: The Haunted House
description: Barney and Gomer try to retrieve a baseball from a supposedly haunted house and find some strange goings on inside.

name: Ernest T. Bass Joins the Army
description: Ernest T. Bass causes a ruckus when he decides to join the Army. When Andy and Barney find out why, they are able to solve his problem.

name: The Sermon for Today
description: A visiting preacher tells the town to relax and enjoy the simple pleasures of life. He inspires everyone to have an old-time band concert.

name: Briscoe Declares for Aunt Bee
description: Briscoe decides he's going to marry Aunt Bee. He even resorts to kidnapping her. Andy comes up with a clever solution to the whole mess.

name: Gomer, the House Guest
description: After Gomer gets fired from the filling station, he moves in with Andy. When people come by to get their cars looked at, Andy has to do something.

name: A Black Day for Mayberry
description: Andy and Barney have to protect a shipment of gold on its way to Fort Knox. Barney spills the beans, and within minutes, all of Mayberry knows.

name: Opie's Ill-Gotten Gain
description: A mistake by Opie's teacher gives him all A's. Everyone is so proud of him that he can't figure out how to break the news without disappointing them.

name: A Date for Gomer
description: Barney has to play matchmaker for Thelma Lou's homely visiting cousin, Mary Grace, and sets her up with Gomer Pyle.

name: Up in Barney's Room
description: Barney's landlady evicts him quite suddenly. When his landlady then marries someone she just met, Barney suspects she's the victim of a con man.

name: Citizen's Arrest
description: Gomer makes a citizen's arrest of Barney for committing the same traffic violation that Gomer did. Barney then resigns and demands jail time.

name: Opie and His Merry Men
description: After watching a movie about Robin Hood, Opie and his pals befriend a hobo who encourages them to steal from those who have and give to him.

name: Barney and the Cave Rescue
description: After Andy and Helen escape from a collapsed cave, they hear that Barney mounted a rescue team, so they go back in to save Barney from embarrassment.

name: Andy and Opie's Pal
description: Opie's new friend Trey is liked by everyone, but Opie becomes jealous when he thinks Andy likes Trey more than him.

name: Aunt Bee the Crusader
description: Aunt Bee organizes a crusade to keep a local man from being evicted because of a highway project, but she doesn't realize he has something to hide.

name: Barney's Sidecar
description: Barney buys an old surplus army motorcycle and sidecar to use on patrol, then becomes a menace to the whole town.

name: My Fair Ernest T. Bass
description: In order to help Ernest find a girl, Andy and Barney teach him some manners. Then they try to pass him off at a party as Andy's cousin from Raleigh.

name: Prisoner of Love
description: A beautiful young prisoner manages to charm both Barney and Andy.

name: Hot Rod Otis
description: Otis has Andy and Barney worried when he buys a car.

name: The Song Festers
description: Barney is the only tenor in the choir. When a tenor solo part is required and the choir director needs someone else to sing the part, Gomer steps in.

name: The Shoplifters
description: Ben complains to Andy that merchandise has been disappearing from his store. While Andy investigates, Barney goes undercover to catch the crooks.

name: Andy's Vacation
description: Andy takes a much-needed vacation, leaving Barney and Gomer in charge. Unfortunately, nobody will let Andy get any rest.

name: Andy Saves Gomer
description: After Andy wakes up Gomer to put out a small fire at the filling station, Gomer dedicates himself to repaying Andy for saving his life.

name: Bargain Day
description: Aunt Bee buys a side of beef. When she gets it home, the freezer doesn't work right, but she won't pay 'the man' from Mount Pilot to come and fix it.

name: Divorce Mountain Style
description: Charlene Darling uses a mountain ritual to divorce Dud Wash and marry Andy.

name: A Deal Is a Deal
description: Opie and his friends get involved in a scheme selling a worthless product called Miracle Salve.

name: Fun Girls
description: Two gals interrupt Andy and Barney's late-night work. Helen and Thelma see them and cancel their dates, so Barney and Andy take the other girls out.

name: Return of Malcolm Merriweather
description: When Malcolm Merriweather returns to Mayberry, Andy hires him to help Aunt Bee with the housework. She goes from being overworked to feeling unneeded.

name: The Rumor
description: Barney sees Andy and Helen in the jewelry store sneaking a kiss and tells everyone they are engaged. Aunt Bee throws a big surprise party for them.

name: Barney and Thelma Low Phfft
description: After Gomer mentions to Thelma Lou that Barney said he 'has her in his hip pocket,' she gets angry and starts dating Gomer.

name: Back to Nature
description: Andy, Barney and Gomer take Opie and his friends camping. Barney, who said he was a great woodsman, manages to get lost in the woods with Gomer.

name: Gomer Pyle, USMC
description: Gomer joins the Marines. When Andy finds out the sergeant plans to get Gomer sent home, he must find a way to get the sergeant on Gomer's side.

name: Opie Loves Helen
description: Opie develops a secret crush and wants to buy her a present. Andy suggests flowers before discovering that the secret crush is Opie's teacher, Helen.

name: Barney's Physical
description: Barney has to gain weight and somehow grow taller in order to meet new guidelines for sheriff's deputies or lose his job. Can he do it?

name: Family Visit
description: The Taylors find that a visit from relatives comes with complications.

name: The Education of Ernest T. Bass
description: Ernest returns to school to win a girl's affection.

name: Aunt Bee's Romance
description: An old beau of Aunt Bee's returns to court her, but he has an annoying sense of humor.

name: Barney's Bloodhound
description: Barney tries to train a mutt and then wants to use him to help capture an escaped convict, despite Andy's objections.

name: Man in the Middle
description: Barney and Thelma Lou have an argument that leads to other arguments between Andy and Barney, Thelma Lou and Helen, and Andy and Helen.

name: Barney's Uniform
description: When a tough guy threatens to beat up Barney if he catches him out of uniform, Barney begins to wear the uniform all the time.

name: Opie's Fortune
description: Opie finds a change purse containing $50 -- which he'll be allowed to keep if no one claims the money within a week.

name: Goodbye Sheriff Taylor
description: Andy considers taking a job in Raleigh and lets Barney take over as sheriff for a day to prepare him for the office.

name: The Pageant
description: When Clara has to go out of town, Aunt Bee gets the leading role in Mayberry's Centennial Pageant, but her acting skills aren't quite up to the task.

name: The Darling Baby
description: The Darling family want a husband for Charlene's new baby daughter. Things get complicated when they choose Opie and won't take no for an answer.

name: Andy and Helen Have their Day
description: Andy and Helen go on a picnic but are plagued by constant interruptions from Barney, Goober and others.

name: Three Wishes for Opie
description: Barney buys a fortune-telling game and lets Opie try it out.

name: Otis Sues the County
description: After Otis falls down in the sheriff's office, a sleazy lawyer convinces him he would be helping Andy and Barney if he were to sue the county.

name: Barney Fife, Realtor
description: Barney tries his hand at real estate. He has a plan that will net him commissions on three sales, but Andy must sell his house and buy another.

name: Goober Takes a Car Apart
description: While Barney's on vacation, Andy needs to find someone to fill in as deputy. He ends up stuck with Goober -- who doesn't take the job seriously.

name: The Rehabilitation of Otis
description: Barney tries to rehabilitate Otis after he rides a cow. Barney arrests Otis when it happens again. Otis leaves town and vows to never return.

name: The Lucky Letter
description: Barney gets a letter that predicts bad luck if he doesn't make copies and send them to friends. He doesn't send any and has nothing but bad luck.

name: Goober and the Art of Love
description: When Andy and Barney get tired of Goober tagging along on their dates, they get him to ask a girl on a date. It proves to be quite a project.

name: Barney Runs for Sheriff
description: Barney decides to run for sheriff when he thinks Andy is leaving Mayberry. When Andy ends up staying, Barney ends up running against him.

name: If I Had a 1/4 Million
description: Barney finds $250,000 from a bank heist, then goes undercover to find the robber.

name: TV or Not TV
description: After Andy is profiled as the 'Sheriff Without a Gun,' a television team comes to town to research a TV show about Mayberry's sheriff department.

name: Guest in the House
description: Helen gets jealous when a very attractive friend of the family visits the Taylor household for a few days.

name: The Case of the Punch in the Nose
description: When he finds an old police file detailing an assault between Floyd and Charles Foley, Barney stirs up a hornets' nest by reopening the case.

name: Opie's Newspaper
description: When nobody buys Opie's newspaper, Andy and Barney encourage him to print more interesting stories. So Opie publishes all the gossip from around town.

name: Aunt Bee's Invisible Beau
description: After Clara gives Aunt Bee the idea that her presence is preventing Andy and Helen from marriage, Aunt Bee names a married man as her imaginary beau.

name: The Arrest of the Fun Girls
description: Two flashy girls from Mount Pilot get a speeding ticket and cause romantic complications for Andy and Barney.

name: The Luck of Newton Monroe
description: A traveling salesman is plagued with bad luck.

name: Opie Flunks Arithmetic
description: Andy is nonchalant when Helen tells him that Opie isn't doing well in math. Barney, however, thinks Andy's attitude is completely off base.

name: Opie and the Carnival
description: Opie tries to win Andy a birthday present at the carnival shooting gallery but gets ripped off by a pair of hucksters using guns with crooked sights.

name: Banjo-Playing Deputy
description: A destitute banjo player fills in for Barney.

name: Opie's Job
description: Opie tries to get a job delivering groceries. He competes with another boy for the job, but learns that the boy needs the money to help his family.

name: Andy's Rival
description: Andy gets jealous when a big-city teacher arrives to work with Helen and ends up spending several evenings with her.

name: Malcolm at the Crossroads
description: Andy gives Malcolm the job of school crossing guard after firing Ernest for throwing rocks at cars. Ernest T. challenges Malcolm to a fight.

name: Aunt Bee the Swinger
description: Aunt Bee and her new beau go out on the town.

name: The Bazaar
description: Andy's eager new deputy jails Aunt Bee and her friends for illegal gambling when they have a bingo game at their church bazaar.

name: Warning from Warren
description: Warren's 'ESP' warns that a picnic will be a disaster for Andy and Helen.

name: Off to Hollywood
description: A movie company is going to make film about Andy, and the Taylors take a trip to Hollywood to see the production.

name: Taylors in Hollywood
description: The Taylors arrive in Hollywood and meet the production team that's making the movie Sheriff Without a Gun.

name: The Hollywood Party
description: Helen gets upset about a picture of Andy and an actress. Andy goes on a date with the actress. When Helen calls, Opie tells her about the date.

name: Aunt Bee on TV
description: Aunt Bee wins big on a TV quiz show.

name: The Cannon
description: Warren's ignorance about cannons helps catch two thieves.

name: A Man's Best Friend
description: Opie and his friend Tommy have fun with walkie-talkies. They listen in on conversations, but Tommy has a sense of humor that not everyone appreciates.

name: Aunt Bee Takes a Job
description: Aunt Bee takes a job at a printing shop. When Andy notices that they print business cards with green ink, he figures out what they're really printing!

name: The Church Organ
description: Clara pleads for a new church organ and Andy gets everyone to pledge money to help buy one, but when the pledges come due, no one wants to pay up.

name: Girl Shy
description: After watching a TV show about a suave adventurer, Warren becomes like the character while sleepwalking. When he wakes up, he can't remember a thing.

name: Otis, the Artist
description: Warren tries to cure Otis's alcoholism by introducing him to mosaic art. Otis takes to it and even stops drinking. But he has no artistic talent.

name: Return of Barney Fife
description: Barney comes back to town for the high school reunion and meets everyone, including Thelma Lou, who has also returned to Mayberry.

name: Legend of Barney Fife
description: While Barney is back in Mayberry, a convict escapes and heads to Mayberry to get even with Barney for sending him to prison the year before.

name: Lost and Found
description: Aunt Bee finds her lost antique pin after spending the insurance money. She thinks she stole from the company, but Warren and Goober ease her worries.

name: Wyatt Earp Rides Again
description: A Wild West show comes to town featuring a wimpy man who is said to be related to Wyatt Earp.

name: Aunt Bee Learns to Drive
description: Aunt Bee takes driving lessons from Goober. But she isn't licensed to drive, and when she moves the car for a tree trimmer, she runs it into the tree.

name: Look Paw, I'm Dancing
description: Opie is looking forward to the school party -- until he learns that it's a dance. Aunt Bee teaches Opie some dance steps that are a bit outdated.

name: The Gypsies
description: Andy runs a band of gypsies out of town. They curse the town, saying it won't rain again. When there's no rain for days, the town turns against Andy.

name: Eat Your Heart Out
description: Goober falls hard for the new waitress at the diner, but she only has eyes for Andy.

name: A Baby in the House
description: When Aunt Bee gets a call from her niece asking if she would take care of their baby, she accepts. But the baby cries every time Bee picks her up.

name: The County Clerk
description: Andy and Helen try their matchmaking skills on Howard Sprague and Miss Fairchild. They find out Howard's mother keeps him on a very short leash.

name: Foster Lady
description: Aunt Bee is asked to star in a commercial for Foster's Furniture Polish.

name: Goober's Replacement
description: Goober's girlfriend, Flora, fills in for him at the gas station. When Wally sees how she brings in the customers, he fires Goober and hires Flora.

name: Battle of Mayberry
description: Opie causes a stir in town when he writes a school paper on the historic Battle of Mayberry. He finds that the truth does not match the legend.

name: A Singer in Town
description: A singer performs a song that Aunt Bee and Clara wrote on his TV show. Unfortunately, his version of the song does not meet with their approval.

name: Opie's Girlfriend
description: Helen's visiting niece, Cynthia, feigns helplessness to charm Opie, even though she is athletically superior to him.

name: The Lodge
description: When Andy nominates Howard for membership in the local lodge, Howard's mother tries to prevent it by spreading a false rumor.

name: Barbershop Quartet
description: When Howard becomes unavailable to sing in a barbershop quartet contest, Andy reluctantly drafts a prisoner to fill in.

name: The Ballgame
description: Andy is drafted to umpire a baseball game and is shunned by the entire town when his call causes Mayberry to lose.

name: Aunt Bee's Crowning Glory
description: Aunt Bee shocks the town with her new blond wig and becomes the object of a visiting minister's attention.

name: The Darling Fortune
description: The Darlings sell some land to the county. Briscoe decides it's time to get his boys married off, and they spend the day in town looking for brides.

name: Mind Over Matter
description: After Goober is involved in a minor traffic accident, Floyd and Aunt Bee convince him he has whiplash.

name: Politics Begins at Home
description: Aunt Bee and Howard Sprague both run for the same seat on the town council.

name: The Senior Play
description: Helen and her students try to close the generation gap by showing that today's kids are no different than yesterday's.

name: Opie Finds a Baby
description: Opie and Arnold find an abandoned baby on the courthouse steps. Afraid that it will be sent to an orphanage, they try to find a home for it.

name: Big Fish in a Small Town
description: After beginner angler Howard lands legendary carp 'Old Sam,' he discovers he has spoiled fishing for everyone by catching The Big One.

name: Only a Rose
description: Aunt Bee has a rose that she thinks will finally win her first place in the annual Garden Club contest -- until Opie accidentally destroys it.

name: Otis the Deputy
description: Otis and Howard try to rescue Andy when he is held captive by two desperate bank robbers on the run.

name: Goober Makes History
description: Goober annoys everyone when he becomes convinced his new beard makes him an intellectual.

name: New Doctor in Town
description: Mayberry has a new doctor in town who runs into difficulty being accepted because no one wants to be his first patient.

name: Don't Miss a Good Bet
description: A slick con man comes to town and dupes several people, including Andy.

name: Dinner at Eight
description: Three friends cook three different dinners for Andy in one night.

name: A Visit to Barney Fife
description: Andy takes a trip to Raleigh to visit Barney and ends up making him a hero by solving a series of robberies.

name: Barney Comes to Mayberry
description: Barney sees a movie star he used to date in Mayberry. When Barney gets to escort her to her movie's premiere, he thinks he's rekindled an old romance.

name: Andy's Old Girlfriend
description: Helen gets jealous when an old girlfriend of Andy's returns to Mayberry.

name: Aunt Bee's Restaurant
description: Aunt Bee enters the business world when she becomes part owner of a Chinese restaurant.

name: Floyd's Barbershop
description: Floyd decides to close the barbershop after Howard buys the building and raises the rent.

name: The Statue
description: After the town has a statue made honoring a heroic Taylor ancestor, they find out he was a swindler.

name: Helen, the Authoress
description: Andy gets jealous when a publisher buys Helen's book for children.

name: Goodbye, Dolly
description: When the milkman buys a truck, he asks Opie to care for his old delivery horse, Dolly. After Dolly refuses to eat, they figure out what's wrong.

name: Opie's Piano Lesson
description: Opie's piano lessons clash with football practice.

name: Howard, the Comedian
description: Howard does a comedy act on a TV amateur hour, telling jokes about the people in Mayberry. The townsfolk get upset when they take the jokes seriously.

name: Big Brother
description: Howard volunteers to be a boy's 'Big Brother' but gets distracted by the boy's pretty older sister.

name: Opie's Most Unforgettable Character
description: Andy's feelings are hurt when Opie doesn't pick him as the subject of a term paper.

name: Goober's Contest
description: Goober holds a contest at the filling station, but an error at the printer's causes one coupon to be worth $200 instead of $10 or less.

name: Opie's First Love
description: Opie's date for Arnold's big birthday party cancels at the last minute to go with a 'cooler' guy.

name: Howard the Bowler
description: Howard fills in on the bowling team and amazes everyone with his skill.

name: A Trip to Mexico
description: Aunt Bee wins a trip to Mexico and takes Clara and Myrtle. When they get back, they aren't even speaking to each other.

name: Andy's Trip to Raleigh
description: Andy has to break a date with Helen to go meet with a lawyer, who turns out to be a pretty blonde. Andy lies to Helen about it, but she finds out.

name: Opie Steps Up in Class
description: Opie makes friends with a rich boy. When they attend a father-son gathering, Andy finds himself acting high-class -- just like he told Opie not to do.

name: Howard's Main Event
description: Howard finds romance with a new girl in town, Millie Hutchins. However, her ex-boyfriend Clyde threatens to beat him up if they don't stop dating.

name: Aunt Bee, the Juror
description: Aunt Bee serves jury duty.

name: Tape Recorder
description: Opie and Arnold record a prisoner telling the whereabouts of the money from a bank robbery.

name: Opie's Group
description: After Opie joins a rock band, he starts to stay out late and gets F's in all of his schoolwork. Aunt Bee has Clara talk to him about the situation.

name: Aunt Bee and the Lecturer
description: Clara has eyes for a visiting professor, but he falls hard for Aunt Bee. She finds out why when he begins to constantly compare her to his late wife.

name: Andy's Investment
description: To pay for Opie's college tuition, Andy opens a laundromat to earn extra money. But the business takes up more of his time than he thought it would.

name: Howard and Millie
description: Howard and Millie decide to get married. On a train trip to Millie's hometown, they discover they might not be as compatible as they had thought.

name: Aunt Bee's Cousin
description: Andy discovers that Aunt Bee's globe-trotting millionaire cousin is actually a hobo and tries to keep the truth from Aunt Bee and everyone else.

name: Suppose Andy Gets Sick
description: Goober takes over at the sheriff's office while Andy has the flu.

name: Howard's New Life
description: After seeing a travelogue about island life on TV, Howard quits his job to become a beachcomber in the Caribbean.

name: Goober, the Executive
description: Goober hears that Wally has the gas station up for sale. With Andy and Emmett as co-signers, Goober is soon the proud owner of his own business.

name: The Mayberry Chef
description: Aunt Bee hosts a cooking show, but Andy and Opie suffer at suppertime.

name: Emmett's Brother-in-Law
description: Emmett's wife pressures him into becoming an insurance salesman, just like his successful brother-in-law.

name: Opie's Drug Store Job
description: Opie gets a job working at the drugstore and learns that everyone makes mistakes.

name: The Church Benefactors
description: A $500 donation to the church causes conflict.

name: Barney Hosts a Summit Meeting
description: When Barney hears about a summit meeting, he volunteers the home of a wealthy Mayberry citizen. But the homeowner refuses to let them use his house.

name: Goober Goes to the Auto Show
description: Goober tags along to an auto show, confident of free samples when salesmen learn he's a 'big operator.' Goober brags that he has a chain of stations.

name: Aunt Bee's Big Moment
description: Aunt Bee takes flying lessons, but doesn't feel ready to fly solo.

name: Helen's Past
description: It seems that Helen was once a gangster's moll when she lived in Kansas City.

name: Emmett's Anniversary
description: Emmett wants to buy Martha a mink coat from Flora's friend. When he and Flora go to get it, Martha sees them and thinks they're having an affair.

name: The Wedding
description: Howard decides to become a 'swinging bachelor' after his mother gets married and moves to Mount Pilot.

name: Sam for Town Council
description: Sam Jones runs against Emmett for a seat on the Town Council.

name: Opie and Mike
description: Opie helps Mike learn how to deal with a bully at school.

name: A Girl for Goober
description: A new dating service with a matchmaking questionnaire focuses on Mayberry -- and soon Goober is filling out the questionnaire erroneously.

name: Mayberry RFD
description: Sam's friend Mario and his family come to help on the farm. When they have difficulty adjusting to Mayberry, Sam wonders whether they should stay.

name: The Curse of the Quon Gwon
How to Recognize Different Types of Trees from Quite a Long Way Away
Man's Crisis of Identity in the Latter Half of the Twentieth Century
The Royal Philharmonic Orchestra Goes to the Bathroom
How to Recognize Different Parts of the Body
Mr. and Mrs. Brian Norris' Ford Popular
Blood, Devastation, Death, War and Horror
Pilot: The Cage
description: Capt. Pike is held prisoner and tested by aliens who have the power to project incredibly lifelike illusions.

name: The Man Trap
description: The crew is stalked by a shape-shifting creature that drains the salt from humans. When it is unintentionally brought aboard, Scotty faces a decision.

name: Charlie X
description: Powerful teenage psychic Charlie beams aboard. Although wanting to be liked, he attacks others until the secret of his powers are revealed to Kirk.

name: Where No Man Has Gone Before
description: As Kirk and Spock investigate a Starfleet tragedy, a friend of Kirk becomes endowed with godlike powers. To stop him, Kirk must hatch a risky plan.

name: The Naked Time
description: A virus causes the Enterprise crew to lose all self-control, as Sulu threatens the crew with a sword, Spock cries and Bones looks for an antidote.

name: The Enemy Within
description: The Enterprise transporter malfunctions and beams Kirk onboard with his evil doppelganger. Scotty saves Kirk and his crew stranded on a frigid planet.

name: Mudd's Women
description: Kirk and the crew rescue Harry Mudd and three 'mail-order brides' from his matchmaking service. Mudd tries to stop Kirk from bringing him to justice.

name: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
description: The Enterprise's search for famous scientist Roger leads Kirk to a deserted planet where Roger, who lives with two lifelike androids, turns on Kirk.

name: Miri
description: The Enterprise arrives at a planet where a virus puts humans in a chronic childlike state. When Kirk and his team become victims, only Bones can help.

name: Dagger of the Mind
description: A deranged doctor escapes to the Enterprise from a planetary penal colony. As Kirk investigates, he is brainwashed by the colony's maniacal director.

name: The Corbomite Maneuver
description: The Enterprise narrowly escapes from imposing alien Balok's starship, but when Balok transmits a distress call, Kirk and the crew go to his aid.

name: The Menagerie: Part 1
description: Spock abducts the Enterprise's injured former captain and sets a course for a forbidden planet. Facing a court-martial, Spock refuses to back down.

name: The Menagerie: Part 2
description: During Spock's court-martial, video images of Capt. Pike's encounter with the psychic Talosians reveal Spock's motivation for hijacking the ship.

name: The Conscience of the King
description: Kodos, a fugitive mass murderer, is a 23rd-century Shakespearean actor. When a friend is murdered, Kirk asks a Shakespearean troupe to investigate.

name: Balance of Terror
description: After Romulan war birds destroy Federation outposts, the Enterprise pursues them. Similarities between them and Vulcans spark bigotry against Spock.

name: Shore Leave
description: The Enterprise lands at a picturesque planet for shore leave, but the idyll is ruined when a Samurai and a bloodthirsty knight attack Sulu and Bones.

name: The Galileo Seven
description: Spock, Bones, Scotty and others crash-land on a planet where they're attacked by deadly giants. Spock risks their lives on a slim chance at a rescue.

name: The Squire of Gothos
description: On a planet where Trelane, a childish alien fascinated by Napoleon, rules with godlike power, the Enterprise is captured. Kirk offers his life for it.

name: Arena
description: Aliens abduct Kirk and a Gorn, a violent, lizard-like humanoid. To save their crews, Kirk and the Gorn must fight to the death, but Kirk refuses.

name: Tomorrow Is Yesterday
description: A black star sends the Enterprise back in time to 1960s Earth. Before they can turn back, Kirk and the crew must destroy all evidence of their visit.

name: Court Martial
description: After an officer is killed in a freak accident, computer records indicate Kirk is to blame.  Evidence at a court-martial reveal that Kirk was framed.

name: The Return of the Archons
description: When the Enterprise travels to a planet where a Starfleet ship disappeared years ago, they find a tyrannical computer who rules its oppressed people.

name: Space Seed
description: The Enterprise encounters brutal super humans led by Khan Noonien Singh, who battles Kirk for control, turning a trusted colleague against Starfleet.

name: A Taste of Armageddon
description: Arriving at a planet where his crew are slated to die, Kirk learns they're in a virtual war in which people must commit suicide to avoid real combat.

name: This Side of Paradise
description: The Enterprise lands on a planet where spores cause everyone to become very passive and affectionate toward one another. Kirk soon learns the secret.

name: The Devil in the Dark
description: When a monster kills several men at a mining colony, Kirk and Spock investigate. Spock learns the odd creature is intelligent, with a valid motive.

name: Errand of Mercy
description: Kirk tries to establish an outpost on a planet inhabited by seemingly primitive Organians.  When Klingons attack, Organians show their true evolution.

name: The Alternative Factor
description: Kirk meets Lazarus, who claims he's chasing his parallel self through space and time and if Kirk doesn't help him, the entire multiverse is at risk.

name: The City on the Edge of Forever
description: Bones travels back to 1930s America and inadvertently destroys the future. To reverse the damage, Kirk and Spock also go back, and Kirk falls in love.

name: Operation: Annihilate!
description: On another planet, Kirk's brother is killed by amoeba like aliens that also infect Spock. Bones tries to cure Spock with light, but causes blindness.

name: Amok Time
description: In the throes of his Pon Farr mating period, Spock must return to Vulcan to meet his intended future wife, betrothed from childhood.

name: Who Mourns for Adonais?
description: A powerful being claiming to be the Greek god Apollo appears and demands that the crew disembark onto his planet to worship him.

name: The Changeling
description: An artificially intelligent probe with a murderously twisted imperative comes on to the Enterprise and confuses Capt. Kirk with his creator.

name: Mirror, Mirror
description: Kirk, McCoy, Scotty and Uhura find themselves in a mirror universe aboard a parallel Enterprise run by ruthless barbarians.

name: The Apple
description: Kirk and a landing party beam down to what seems to be an ideal, Eden-like planet.

name: The Doomsday Machine
description: The Enterprise encounters the wrecked Constellation, whose distraught captain is determined to stop the giant ship that killed his crew.

name: Catspaw
description: When Kirk and his landing party arrive on the planet below, they are met with eerie mists, a dark castle, witches, goblins and a black cat.

name: I, Mudd
description: Harry Mudd returns with a plot to take over the Enterprise by stranding the crew on a planet populated by androids under his command.

name: Metamorphosis
description: The Enterprise encounters a mysterious energy cloud that pulls them down to planet Gamma Canaris N, where they meet a castaway.

name: Journey to Babel
description: The Enterprise hosts a number of quarrelling diplomats -- including Spock's father -- but someone on board has murder in mind.

name: Friday's Child
description: The Federation is in competition with the Klingons for an alliance with the inhabitants of Capella IV, a warrior tribe.

name: The Deadly Years
description: A landing party from the Enterprise is exposed to strange form of radiation that rapidly ages them.

name: Obsession
description: Capt. Kirk obsessively hunts for a mysterious cloud creature he encountered in his youth.

name: Wolf in the Fold
description: Scotty is suspected of murdering a belly dancer.

name: The Trouble with Tribbles
description: Kirk must deal with Federation bureaucrats, a Klingon battle cruiser and a peddler who sells furry, purring, hungry little creatures as pets.

name: The Gamesters of Triskelion
description: Kirk, Uhura and Chekhov are trapped on a planet where gladiators are enslaved and trained to perform for the amusement of bored, faceless aliens.

name: A Piece of the Action
description: Kirk, Spock and McCoy beam down and find themselves in a culture similar to Earth gangs of the 1920s.

name: The Immunity Syndrome
description: The Enterprise encounters a gigantic, energy-draining space organism that threatens the galaxy.

name: A Private Little War
description: Kirk returns to the planet Neural, where he spent time 13 years earlier. A friend of Kirk's from his previous visit is now the leader of its people.

name: Return to Tomorrow
description: The last three members of an ancient race far more advanced than humans wish to borrow the bodies of Kirk, Spock and Dr. Mulhall.

name: Patterns of Force
description: Looking for a missing Federation cultural observer, Kirk and Spock find themselves on a planet whose culture is modeled on the Nazi Party.

name: By Any Other Name
description: Kirk, Spock, McCoy and a couple of red shirts beam down to the surface of a planet in answer to a fake distress call.

name: The Omega Glory
description: Kirk finds Capt. Tracey of the USS Exeter violating the prime directive and interfering with a war between the Yangs and the Kohms.

name: The Ultimate Computer
description: The Enterprise is chosen to be the test ship for the new M-5 multitronic computer system, which is designed to run a ship without human help.

name: Bread and Circuses
description: The Enterprise discovers a planet whose oppressive government is a 20th-century version of Earth's Roman Empire.

name: Assignment: Earth
description: The Enterprise is assigned to observe Earth's history in 1968.

name: Spock's Brain
description: When a mysterious intruder on the 'Enterprise' cunningly steals Spock's brain, Bones tries to keep the Vulcan alive while Kirk tracks down the thief.

name: The Enterprise Incident
description: On Kirk's orders, the Enterprise deliberately crosses the Neutral Zone into Romulan space and is promptly surrounded by Romulan warships.

name: The Paradise Syndrome
description: Trapped on a planet whose inhabitants resemble American Indians, Kirk loses his memory and is proclaimed a God.

name: And the Children Shall Lead
description: The Enterprise reaches a Federation colony where the adults have all killed each other but the children play without care.

name: Is There In Truth No Beauty?
description: The Enterprise transports the Medusan ambassador Kollos; his telepathic interpreter, Dr. Miranda Jones; and engineer Laurence Marvick.

name: Spectre of the Gun
description: As punishment for trespassing on their planet, the inhabitants condemn Capt. Kirk and his landing party to reenact the Gunfight at the O.K. Corral.

name: Day of the Dove
description: An entity traps the Enterprise crew and the crew of a disabled Klingon battle cruiser in an unending war aboard the Enterprise.

name: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
description: The Enterprise discovers that an apparent asteroid on a collision course with a planet is actually an ancient populated generation ship.

name: The Tholian Web
description: Kirk and the derelict starship Defiant vanish into a spatial interphase between universes.

name: Plato's Stepchildren
description: On an urgent medical emergency, Kirk, Spock and McCoy encounter an alien society that had once flourished on Earth during the time of Plato.

name: Wink of an Eye
description: The Enterprise responds to a distress call from the planet Scalos, but when a landing party beams down, they find no living beings.

name: The Empath
description: Trapped in an alien laboratory, Kirk, Spock and McCoy meet an empath and are involved in a series of experiments.

name: Elaan of Troyius
description: The Enterprise transports Elaan, a member of the ruling dynasty of the warrior Elasians, to the planet of their enemy, the Troyians.

name: Whom Gods Destroy
description: Kirk and Spock are taken prisoner by a former starship captain who now resides at -- and has taken over -- an asylum for the criminally insane.

name: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
description: The Enterprise encounters two duo-chromatic and mutually belligerent aliens who put the ship in the middle of their old conflict.

name: The Mark of Gideon
description: Kirk beams down to the planet Gideon and appears to find himself trapped on the deserted Enterprise.

name: That Which Survives
description: After the Enterprise landing party beams down to investigate a geologically interesting planet, their ship is hurled across the galaxy.

name: The Lights of Zetar
description: The Enterprise is on course to install new equipment on Memory Alpha, the central library storage facility for the Federation.

name: Requiem for Methuselah
description: Kirk, Spock and McCoy beam down to a supposedly uninhabited planet to gather the mineral ryetalyn to fight a plague of Rigelian fever.

name: The Way to Eden
description: The Enterprise is ordered to pursue a group of antiestablishment idealists who have stolen a space cruiser.

name: The Cloud Minders
description: Kirk and Spock are caught up in a revolution on a planet where intellectuals and artists live in a utopian city in the sky.

name: The Savage Curtain
description: Kirk, Spock, Abraham Lincoln and Surak are pitted in battle against four notorious villains from history.

name: All Our Yesterdays
description: The planet Sarpeidon is about to be destroyed by its star, Beta Niobe, becoming a supernova.

name: Turnabout Intruder
description: Kirk is confronted with the deep hatred of an old love, Janice Lester, who is severely ill from celebium radiation.

name: Skattkartan
description: After finding a treasure map, Bamse and Lille Skutt embark on a hunt for the loot -- but Vargen and pirates are in hot pursuit!

name: Skatts√∂karf√§rden
description: Following his grandmother's treasure map, Bamse sails away with Lille Skutt on a hunt for treasure. But Vargen threatens to find it first!

name: Vulkanutbrottet
description: When an old volcano erupts in the hills, Bamse discovers it is being caused by a surprising source.

name: Den hungriga draken
description: When an old volcano erupts, a hungry fire-breathing dragon appears.

name: Vargen √§ter dunderhonung
description: With dreams of becoming as strong as Bamse -- and using that power to rob banks -- Vargen plans to steal some thunder honey.

name: Den flygande mattan
description: Bamse and Lille Skutt take a trip on a flying carpet to a castle above the clouds.

name: Trollkarlen
description: Bamse and Lille Skutt encounter an evil wizard while on their magic carpet journey.

name: Den lilla √•snan
description: After rescuing a little donkey from an evil man, Bamse discovers his new friend can run as fast as a train.

name: Den stora kappl√∂pningen
description: Donkey takes part in a race. Kroisos, the ruthless mole, enters his own horse in the competition and stops at nothing to secure his team's victory.

name: Bamse i Trollskogen
description: Pomppi's ears become carrots, Wolf transforms into a balloon, and Donkey becomes a pig ‚Äì is the witch behind all this? Only Bamse can stop her.

name: The Adventures of Panda and Friends Fuss in the Zoo
description: Little Mimiko lives all by herself in a house surrounded by bamboo trees. One day, she meets a pair of pandas and they all decide to live together.

name: The Adventures of Panda and Friends The Circus in the Rain
description: Mimiko, Panny and Papa Panda have been having lots of fun living together. A baby tiger is found sleeping in Panny's bed.

name: Beyond the Farthest Star
description: In orbit around a dead star, the Enterprise comes across a huge starship inhabited by a parasitic life form that threatens the entire ship.

name: Yesteryear
description: Spock must return to his own past on Vulcan to prevent his death as a youngster.

name: One of Our Planets Is Missing
description: The crew of the Enterprise races to find a way to stop a cloud from destroying inhabited planets.

name: The Lorelei Signal
description: The men of the Enterprise are victimized by a race of beautiful women who stay immortal by draining the lifeforce of men.

name: More Tribbles, More Troubles
description: Cyrano Jones returns, along with new tribbles that can't multiply.

name: The Survivor
description: The Enterprise finds missing trader and philanthropist Carter Winston, but he may not be what he appears to be.

name: The Infinite Vulcan
description: Kirk and the crew are faced with a race of intelligent plants and a mad scientist who wants to impose peace on the galaxy.

name: The Magicks of Megus-Tu
description: The Enterprise goes to the center of the galaxy, where they find a race of powerful aliens who once fled Earth.

name: Once Upon a Planet
description: Kirk returns to the 'shore leave' planet, but it's not as peaceful as it was when they last saw it.

name: Mudd's Passion
description: The crew encounters Harry Mudd again, who is selling a fake love potion.

name: The Terratin Incident
description: The crew of the Enterprise finds themselves shrinking after being bathed with radiation.

name: The Ambergris Element
description: While exploring the planet Argo, Kirk and Spock are turned into water breathers.

name: The Slaver Weapon
description: Spock, Sulu and Uhura are captured by the Kzinti, who are trying to learn the secret of an ancient weapon.

name: Eye of the Beholder
description: While searching for a lost ship, Kirk, Spock and McCoy are captured and placed in a zoo by advanced, telepathic aliens.

name: Jihad
description: Kirk leads a party to retrieve a religious relic that was stolen.

name: The Time Trap
description: The Enterprise and a Klingon ship must join forces to escape from a pocket universe that has been trapping starships for centuries.

name: Pirates of Orion
description: When Spock is stricken by a disease fatal to Vulcans, the Enterprise is to meet a freighter with a load of drugs that provides the only cure.

name: Bem
description: On a planetary survey mission, Kirk and Spock have to deal with a reckless observer named Bem.

name: The Practical Joker
description: After passing through an unusual cloud, the Enterprise computer develops a playful, and potentially lethal, personality.

name: Albatross
description: Dr. McCoy is arrested and held responsible for causing a plague that ravaged the planet Dramia Two, where he did a mass inoculation 19 years earlier.

name: How, Sharper Than a Serpent's Tooth
description: The Enterprise crew encounters an alien who visited Earth in ancient times and became known as the Mayan god Kukulkan.

name: The Counterclock Incident
description: The Enterprise tries to save an unidentified ship plunging into a supernova but is dragged into a universe where time runs backwards.

name: A Touch of Class
description: In the pilot of this beloved British comedy, Basil's attempt to bring in upper-crust guests backfires when Lord Melbury arrives.

name: The Builders
description: With the hotel in need of repairs, Basil hires dirt-cheap O'Reilly, whose shoddy work leaves Fawlty Towers in worse shape than ever.

name: The Wedding Party
description: A series of shocking encounters leads Basil to believe the hotel is turning into a den of debauchery.

name: The Hotel Inspectors
description: Upon hearing that hotel inspectors are in the area, Basil fears the guest he had been menacing is an inspector and goes to extremes to impress him.

name: Gourmet Night
description: It looks like a swanky soiree for VIP guests will end in disaster when the Fawlty Towers chef gets stewed, but Basil springs into action.

name: The Germans
description: With Sybil away on medical leave, Fawlty Towers turns chaotic when Basil has an unfortunate run-in with a mounted moose head.

name: Communication Problems
description: Basil's attempt to hide his horse racing winnings from Sybil is complicated by the Major's befuddled money management skills and an annoying guest.

name: The Psychiatrist
description: Sybil fancies a young hotel guest, and her flirtatious manner with the man infuriates Basil, much to the amusement of a psychiatrist staying there.

name: Waldorf Salad
description: An American invades Fawlty Towers, upsetting Basil with complaints and demanding a late meal of Waldorf salad, a dish Basil has no idea how to make.

name: The Kipper and the Corpse
description: When a guest dies at Fawlty Towers, the frantic hotelier believes it was the kitchen's stale kippers that killed him.

name: The Anniversary
description: Convinced Basil's forgotten their anniversary, Sybil storms off, unaware that he's planned a surprise party. So Basil gets Polly to impersonate Sybil.

name: Basil the Rat
description: Basil puts on his exterminator hat when Manuel's pet rodent escapes and a health inspector comes to Fawlty Towers.

name: The Showing Up of Corporal Jones
The Bullet Is Not For Firing
The Day The Balloon Went Up
The Two And A Half Feathers
Christmas Special: Battle Of The Giants
The Desperate Drive Of Corporal Jones
The King Was In His Counting House
When Did You Last See Your Money
Round And Round Went The Great Wheel
Things That Go Bump In The Night
Is There Honey Still For Tea
Come In Your Time Is Up
Christmas Special 1975: My Brother And I
Christmas Special: The Love Of Three Oranges
Episode 1
description: In the spring, a mysterious bud sprouts in Cindy and Frank's garden.

name: Episode 2
description: Barbapapa tours the city and encounters many dangers.

name: Episode 3
description: Barbapapa and his friends decide to explore the wonders of the sea by embarking on a submarine expedition.

name: Episode 4
description: Barbapapa feels lonely and his friends try to cheer him up, with no success. Barbapapa sets off to look for more Barbapapas with Cindy and Frank.

name: Episode 5
description: Barbapapa, Cindy and Frank are traveling. They sail across the sea and arrive in London, where they hope to find more Barbapapas.

name: Episode 6
description: Barbapapa is traveling in India with his friends. They meet a fakir and decide to ask him where they could find more Barbapapas.

name: Episode 7
description: Barbapapa, Cindy and Frank are still searching for Barbamama. Will they find her in America?

name: Episode 8
description: After many adventures, Barbapapa returns home and finally meets Barbamama. Upon spring seven adorable Barbababies are born.

name: Episode 9
description: The Barbafamily goes sailing, but a suddenly rising storm threatens to wreck the sailboat.

name: Episode 10
description: Barbapapa and Barbamama move to a beautiful old house with their children.

name: Episode 11
description: The Barbapapas are so happy with their new house. Unfortunately, construction workers show up and ask them to move out.

name: Episode 12
description: Oh, how cute the Barbapapas' house is! Each family member has a room. Help! The bulldozers are coming!

name: Episode 13
description: Barbabelle and Barbalala are playing with a train and blocks, and their brothers want to help too.

name: Episode 14
description: Barbapapa travels through the desert in a camel caravan. The animals are exhausted and very thirsty. Where could they find water?

name: Episode 15
description: Barbazoo finds small eggs, but none of the birds want them. He decides to hatch them himself.

name: Episode 16
description: Barbabeau starts painting classes, but he has trouble following the instructions. At the end of the lesson, a big surprise awaits him.

name: Episode 17
description: Barbabravo shows Barbabright and Barbalala his skills in tennis and other sports, but horseback riding turns out to be difficult.

name: Episode 18
description: The Barbapapas are babysitting baby Anna.

name: Episode 19
description: Barbabright invents an orange press.

name: Episode 20
description: Barbapapa steps in as a station manager and prevents a train accident.

name: Episode 21
description: Barbabeau teaches pottery to his siblings. Barbalala shapeshifts into a vase to trick Barbabright. Barbabeau makes a statue of his father.

name: Episode 22
description: Barbapapa decides to do a good deed. He wants to free animals in captivity and shapeshifts into a travel trunk.

name: Episode 23
description: Barbapapa transports a group of animals back to Africa. The animals are very happy to reconnect with their families.

name: Episode 24
description: When it is time to shear the sheep, something unexpected happens: Barbabeau is sheared as well.

name: Episode 25
description: Barbabeau is cold. Barbamama invents a loom to weave something warm for him to wear.

name: Episode 26
description: When Barbazoo helps his father to milk the cows, a menacing evil bull breaks free.

name: Episode 27
description: Barbamama gently cares for her little calves and is fully focused on feeding them. How could the Barbababies get their mother's attention?

name: Episode 28
description: The Barbafamily girls play dress up, but all the layers of clothing create trouble.

name: Episode 29
description: Barbababies give Barbabeau a new hairstyle, but the result make him he is far from happy about the result.

name: Episode 30
description: Barbabravo is learning to ski with his friend Cindy. Suddenly, Cindy falls and hurts her leg.

name: Episode 31
description: The water is polluted making the animals sick. The Barbapapas take care of them together.

name: Episode 32
description: Barbazoo picks flowers in the woods and finds a baby bird fallen from a nest. Barbazoo naps under a tree and wakes up to a surprise.

name: Episode 33
description: Barbabright decides to build his own vessel.

name: Episode 34
description: Barbabeau encounters his old pal the hedgehog. A nasty surprise interrupts their nap together under a tree.

name: Episode 35
description: The Barbafamily is working hard to harvest grapes, but the work is slow. Barbabright creates a new fancy press. But is it a good solution after all?

name: Episode 36
description: Insect attack startles Barbazoo, who is tending to his fruit trees.

name: Episode 37
description: Barbabright loves birds. Wouldn't it be wonderful to fly like them?

name: Episode 38
description: Barbabright and Barbabeau become fashion photographers. Barbabelle is interested, but unfortunately she is not suitable for modeling.

name: Episode 39
description: Barbalala's harp and flute playing is magic. Barbabelle falls asleep and dreams about bringing the house down.

name: Episode 40
description: Secret birthday plans are on the way for Barbapapa's birthday. Barbamama and the children are going to bake him an amazing cake.

name: Episode 41
description: An eagle snatches the Barbafamily's dog. Barbabravo sets to rescue her from the mountaintop and the siblings follow suit. But how can they get down?

name: Episode 42
description: Hunting is strictly forbidden in the Barbapapas' forest. Nevertheless, the hunters are coming with their dogs.

name: Episode 43
description: When they are having a picnic at the beach, the Barbapapas notice whalers pursuing a poor whale.

name: Episode 44
description: Barbapapa starts an animal conservation area, but little by little, his land is surrounded by the city, factories and cars.

name: Episode 45
description: When they notice that people are making an effort to stop pollution, the Barbapapas return to Earth.

name: Episode 1
description: Barbalib is proud of her new piggy bank, but when she gets up in the morning, it is gone. Who could have stolen the piggy bank?

name: Episode 2
description: Bullfighting is a brutal sport. Barbapapa decides to help the bull.

name: Episode 3
description: Barbapapa, Cindy and Frank travel to Mexico, where they learn many mysterious stories.

name: Episode 4
description: The Barbafamily visits Canadian First Nations' peoples in the Far North.

name: Episode 5
description: Barbamama takes care of a tiny baby while the rest of the family is cooking. But who will eat all this delicious food?

name: Episode 6
description: The Barbapapas go to the circus with their friends. But why is the circus tent empty?

name: Episode 7
description: The new zoo vet turns out to be Barbazoo. He takes good care of the sick animals, but why is the elephant mother so sad?

name: Episode 8
description: The Barbapapas' rooms look so similar that the nearsighted postman is constantly mistaken. What could be done to help him?

name: Episode 9
description: Barbamama decides to organize a party for baby Anna's birthday. The whole family wants to help, but is it really a good idea?

name: Episode 10
description: The Barbapapas are playing magician in a peculiar house. Odd creatures crawl out of the cauldron after a sudden explosion.

name: Episode 11
description: Cindy has a broken leg. The Barbapapas want to cheer her up so they shapeshift into musical instruments.

name: Episode 12
description: When parks and nature must give way to concrete and motorways, the Barbapapas destroy the new buildings. Concrete is replaced by trees and flowers.

name: Episode 13
description: The Barbapapas visit a toy factory and play with marionettes, mechanical puppets and music boxes.

name: Episode 14
description: A mysterious thief empties the pantry every single evening.

name: Episode 15
description: When he does not want to do the dishes, Barbabravo builds a robot to help. But is it a good idea, after all?

name: Episode 16
description: Barbapapa decides to participate in an African safari in order to warn and protect the animals. Hunters are also attending.

name: Episode 17
description: Barbapapa shapeshifts into a pink whale to distract the whalers away from their prey.

name: Episode 18
description: It is so much fun to hide in the wallpaper.

name: Episode 19
description: The Barbapapas visit a saloon dressed up as cowboys.

name: Episode 20
description: What happened to the freshly baked pie?

name: Episode 21
description: Mother hen has disappeared and all her eggs are broken. What has happened?

name: Episode 22
description: Barbabravo is proud of his new car and wants to take the children for a ride.

name: Episode 23
description: The Barbapapas travel with a wagon in the Wild West and encounter local inhabitants.

name: Episode 24
description: Barbabright is convinced he saw a dinosaur in the garden. Could it be true?

name: Episode 25
description: While the Barbababies play pirates on the beach, Barbapapa takes a nap. But where did he disappear to?

name: Episode 26
description: Everybody has a special skill: Barbabright teaches mechanics and Barbazoo science...

name: Episode 27
description: Barbabeau must take a photo of the winner of a dog show, but the winning dog has disappeared.

name: Episode 28
description: It is Christmas and there is a lot of snow. Playing in the snow is so much fun.

name: Episode 29
description: Who has dressed up as a ghost?

name: Episode 30
description: The Barbapapas visit a school for the first time. Help! The students are just fighting and causing chaos.

name: Episode 31
description: Barbabravo becomes a shepherd and starts producing cheese. But what mysterious creature is stealing the cheese at night?

name: Episode 32
description: The Barbapapas are on vacation in a mountain cabin. They end up having the scare of their lives.

name: Episode 33
description: Professor Panda is giving a conference on the world's endangered animals and plants.

name: Episode 34
description: Barbabelle's necklace, Barbabright's telescope and Barbalala's flute disappear mysteriously.

name: Episode 35
description: Barbabeau admires the sunset at dinner time. The Barbafamily receives a strange message from Leonardo da Vinci.

name: Episode 36
description: The Barbafamily wants to see who can build the best car. They build pull carts, microcars, steam cars, and so on.

name: Episode 37
description: There is a devastating drought. The Barbapapas decide to travel to the South Pole to find an iceberg.

name: Episode 38
description: Barbabright invites the family to a midnight magic show in an old castle.

name: Episode 39
description: Barbalib casts the whole family in a play.

name: Episode 40
description: Inspired by the drought, Barbazoo invents an irrigation device to water the plants in the desert.

name: Episode 41
description: The circus troupe will not stop at the Barbapapas' town, because it is too small.

name: Episode 42
description: There is a fist fight at the schoolyard. All will be quickly sorted out with a new activity.

name: Episode 43
description: The Barbapapas take different shapes to get closer to the animals of the jungle. They quickly notice poachers snatching baby animals.

name: Episode 44
description: Dressed in kimonos, the Barbafamily explores the Japanese culture.

name: Episode 45
description: The Barbababies are proud of their herb garden. There is a task for everyone: digging holes and planting seeds. Oh no, who forgot to lock the gate?

name: Episode 46
description: Barbazoo observes the migration of the ducks. Help! The hunters are lurking with their guns. Barbazoo finds a small injured duck.

name: Episode 47
description: The Barbapapas introduce themselves and show how they can transform into different shapes. Barbabright shows off his skills.

name: Episode 48
description: The Barbafamily artist Barbabeau and the coquette Barbabelle introduce themselves.

name: Episode 49
description: Barbazoo is passionate about animals. Barbalala falls asleep and dreams about being a butterfly.

name: Episode 50
description: Barbabravo is too heavy to get on a horse. Barbazoo shapeshifts into a horse so his brother can ride.

name: Episode 51
description: Cindy, Frank and the Barbapapas would like to meet a dragon living at the bottom of the sea.

name: Episode 52
description: Cindy and Frank fly on a hot air balloon. The Barbapapas build their own balloon. Wind blows Cindy and Frank onto a high mountain. How to save them?

name: Episode 53
description: Cindy, Frank and the Barbababies are excited to sleep on a deserted island. But there is nothing in the cold cabin and a storm is coming.

name: Episode 54
description: Barbamama is surprised by heavy rain. No one has an umbrella, so Barbamama becomes a huge umbrella giving shelter to all the people of the city.

name: Episode 55
description: A little squirrel is collecting nuts for winter in the woods and is surprised by Barbazoo.

name: Episode 1
description: 3.3 billion years before Christ. The first cells started to appear, but it would still be billions of years before the first human arrives.

name: Episode 2
description: Man walks upright and forms groups. Teacher can carve flint and passes on his wisdom to his fellow men but he has yet to discovered fire.

name: Episode 3
description: Men live in tribes. Pedrito‚Äôs tribe can make tools but Ti√±oso‚Äôs cannot. Teacher suggest a trade--the first in history.

name: Episode 4
